main event: The report describes an unidentified object sighted on April 26, 1967 in Creston, Iowa. The object changed color, changed direction, and appeared to grow in size before diminishing and disappearing.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a definite object, larger than a bright planet or star, with an amber or reddish color.
The object seemed to hover, start and stop, and change in size from a light to an object about 20 degrees across.
The sighting was witnessed by the observer, who was a minister, and his 76-year-old landlord.
The observer reported the sighting to Wright-Patterson Air Force Base.
The report contains a detailed questionnaire with the observer's responses about the sighting.
sighted object: an unidentified object that changed color and size
witnesses: the observer, who was a minister, and his 76-year-old landlord
